item.text: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijah became king over Judah.

He <st data-num="04427" class="">ruled</st> for <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> His <st data-num="08034 0517">mother</st> was <st data-num="04601" class="">Maacah</st>, the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="053" class="">Abishalom</st>.<n id="2" />
He followed all the sinful practices of his father before him. He was not wholeheartedly devoted to the Lord his God, as his ancestor David had been.
Nevertheless for David’s sake the Lord his God maintained his dynasty in Jerusalem by giving him a son to succeed him and by protecting Jerusalem.

He did this<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">because</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st> <st data-num="03477" class="">what</st> <st data-num="03068" class="">he</st> <st data-num="05869" class="">approved</st><n id="2" /> and had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">disregarded</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">any</st> of his <st data-num="06680" class="">commandments</st><n id="3" /> his <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="03117 02416">lifetime</st>, <st data-num="07535" class="">except</st> for the <st data-num="01697" class="">incident</st> involving <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st> the <st data-num="02850" class="">Hittite</st>.

<st data-num="07346" class="">Rehoboam</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> continually at <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">with each</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">other</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">throughout</st> Abijah’s<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03117 02416">lifetime</st>.

The <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="01697" class="">events</st> of <st data-num="038" class="">Abijah’s</st> reign, including <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="0834 06213">accomplishments</st>, are <st data-num="03808 01992 03789">recorded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st> called the <st data-num="01697 03117">Annals</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">Kings</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="038" class="">Abijah</st> and <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st> had <st data-num="01961" class="">been</st> at <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">with each</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">other</st>.
Abijah passed away and was buried in the City of David. His son Asa replaced him as king.
In the twentieth year of Jeroboam’s reign over Israel, Asa became the king of Judah.

He <st data-num="04427" class="">ruled</st> for <st data-num="0705 0259" class="">41</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> His <st data-num="08034 0517">grandmother</st><n id="2" /> was <st data-num="04601" class="">Maacah</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> of <st data-num="053" class="">Abishalom</st>.
Asa did what the Lord approved as his ancestor David had done.

He <st data-num="05674" class="">removed</st> the <st data-num="06945" class="">male cultic prostitutes</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> and <st data-num="05493" class="">got rid of</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01544 0834">disgusting idols</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st><n id="2" /> had <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st>.

He <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">removed</st> <st data-num="04601" class="">Maacah</st> his <st data-num="0517" class="">grandmother</st><n id="1" /> from her position as <st data-num="01377" class="">queen mother</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">because</st> she had <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> a <st data-num="04656" class="">loathsome</st> <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah pole</st>. <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa</st> <st data-num="03772" class="">cut down</st> her <st data-num="04656" class="">loathsome pole</st> and <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st> it in the <st data-num="06939" class="">Kidron</st> <st data-num="05158" class="">Valley</st>.
The high places were not eliminated, yet Asa was wholeheartedly devoted to the Lord throughout his lifetime.
He brought the holy items that he and his father had made into the Lord’s temple, including the silver, gold, and other articles.
Now Asa and King Baasha of Israel were continually at war with each other.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="05927 05921">attacked</st> <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="01129" class="">established</st> <st data-num="07414" class="">Ramah</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">as a military outpost</st> to <st data-num="01115" class="">prevent</st> anyone <st data-num="05414" class="">from</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">leaving</st> or <st data-num="0935" class="">entering</st> the land of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.<n id="1" />

Asa took all the silver and gold that was left in the treasuries of the Lord’s temple and of the royal palace and handed it to his servants. He then told them to deliver it to Ben Hadad son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, ruler in Damascus, along with this message:

“I <st data-num="0996" class="">want</st> to make a <st data-num="01285" class="">treaty</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">with</st> you, like the <st data-num="0996 01">one</st> our <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">made</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02009" class="">See</st>, I have <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> you <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> and <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> as a <st data-num="07810" class="">present</st>. <st data-num="01980 06565">Break</st> your <st data-num="01285" class="">treaty</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, so he will <st data-num="05927" class="">retreat</st> from my <st data-num="05921" class="">land</st>.”<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01130" class="">Ben Hadad</st> <st data-num="08085 0413">accepted</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa’s</st> offer and <st data-num="07971" class="">ordered</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">his</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to attack</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="1" /> They <st data-num="05221" class="">conquered</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05859" class="">Ijon</st>, <st data-num="01835" class="">Dan</st>, <st data-num="062" class="">Abel Beth Maacah</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">territory</st> of <st data-num="05321" class="">Naphtali</st>, including the <st data-num="03605" class="">region</st> of <st data-num="03672" class="">Kinnereth</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> <st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> the news, he <st data-num="02308" class="">stopped</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">fortifying</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07414" class="">Ramah</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">settled down</st> in <st data-num="08656" class="">Tirzah</st>.

King Asa ordered all the men of Judah (no exemptions were granted) to carry away the stones and wood that Baasha had used to build Ramah. King Asa used the materials to build up Geba (in Benjamin) and Mizpah.

The rest of the events of Asa’s reign, including all his successes and accomplishments, as well as a record of the cities he built, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah. Yet when he was very old he developed a foot disease.
Asa passed away and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his ancestor David. His son Jehoshaphat replaced him as king.
In the second year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Jeroboam’s son Nadab became the king of Israel; he ruled Israel for two years.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord. He followed in his father’s footsteps and encouraged Israel to sin.

Baasha son of Ahijah, from the tribe of Issachar, conspired against Nadab and assassinated him in Gibbethon, which was in Philistine territory. This happened while Nadab and all the Israelite army were besieging Gibbethon.

<st data-num="01201" class="">Baasha</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">killed</st> him in the <st data-num="07969" class="">third</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of <st data-num="0609" class="">Asa’s</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">reign over</st> <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="08478" class="">replaced</st> him as <st data-num="04427" class="">king</st>.
When he became king, he executed Jeroboam’s entire family. He wiped out everyone who breathed, in keeping with the Lord’s message that he had spoken through his servant Ahijah the Shilonite.
This happened because of the sins which Jeroboam committed and which he made Israel commit. These sins angered the Lord God of Israel.
The rest of the events of Nadab’s reign, including all his accomplishments, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Asa and King Baasha of Israel were continually at war with each other.
In the third year of Asa’s reign over Judah, Baasha son of Ahijah became king over all Israel in Tirzah; he ruled for 24 years.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord; he followed in Jeroboam’s footsteps and encouraged Israel to sin.
